metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40433 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in function ciMethodBlocks::make_block_at in OracleJDK (HotSpot VM) 11, 17 and OpenJDK (HotSpot VM) 8, 11, 17, allowsattackers to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre-jamvm - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
openjdk-8-source - 8u392-ga-1~16.04
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8u392-ga-1~16.04').
openjdk-9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
